clinical_study.brief_title: Sleep-Disordered Breathing in Patients With Severe Valvular Regurgitation Undergoing Clip Procedure
clinical_study.official_title: Prevalence and Dynamics of Sleep-Disordered Breathing (SDB) in Patients With Severe Valvular Regurgitation and High Surgical Risk Undergoing Minimally Invasive Clip Procedure

lead_sponsor.agency: Heart and Diabetes Center North-Rhine Westfalia

clinical_study.source: Heart and Diabetes Center North-Rhine Westfalia

brief_summary.textblock: In a prospective observational study, the investigators investigate the prevalence of sleep disordered breathing in patients with severe valvular regurgitation and the effect of using the minimal invasive Clip technique on sleep disordered breathing.

detailed_description.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to analyze the prevalance of sleep disordered breathing in patients with severe valvular regurgitation and the impact of a therapy with the minimal-invasive Clip technique.
Therefore, the investigators want to include consecutive patients with unknown sleep-associated respiratory distress syndrome and, in addition, as a study-specific achievement, the investigators want to obtain the quality of life and specific symptoms of the patients by using established questionnaires. After three month of post-interventional care, the patients will get a post-interventional check-up in our cardiological outpatient clinic, where the course of sleep-associated respiratory distress syndrome and the actual quality of life and specific symptoms will be documented by using a cardiorespiratory polygraphy and the same questionnaires.
The entire hospital stay, including possible post-interventional complications, will be documented for this study from the patients' medical records. The routine examinations (laboratory values, ECG, 6-minute walk test, pulmonary function examinations, spiroergometry, transthoracic / -oesophageal echocardiography, etc.) shall also be recorded in the database of this study.
The plan is to include 100 evaluable patients with complete follow-up and the associated test results. For this purpose, a screening of 150 patients is expected to be required.

primary_outcome.measure: Prevalance of Sleep disordered breathing in Patiens with severe valvular regurgitation
primary_outcome.description: Proportion of of Sleep disordered breathing in Patiens with severe valvular regurgitation in a given time period

primary_outcome.measure: Influence of the minimal invasive Clip technique on apnea-hypopnea index
primary_outcome.description: Changes on the number of apnea and hypopnea events per hour of sleep due to the minimal invasiv Clip technique

primary_outcome.measure: Influence of the minimal invasive Clip technique on apnea index
primary_outcome.description: Changes on the number of apnea events per hour of sleep due to the minimal invasiv Clip technique

primary_outcome.measure: Influence of the minimal invasive Clip technique on the oxygen desaturation index
primary_outcome.description: Changes on the number of times per hour of sleep that the blood's oxygen level drop by a certain degree from baseline due to the minimal invasiv Clip technique

primary_outcome.measure: Influence of the minimal invasive Clip technique on T90
primary_outcome.description: Changes on the the percentage of time during which arterial O2 saturation was less than 90% (T90) due to the minimal invasiv Clip technique

primary_outcome.measure: Influence of the minimal invasive Clip technique on sleep cycle length
primary_outcome.description: Changes on the duration of the five stages of sleep (in minutes) due to the minimal invasiv Clip technique

primary_outcome.measure: Influence of the minimal invasive Clip technique on ventilation length during sleep
primary_outcome.description: Changes on the ventilation length (in seconds) due to the minimal invasiv Clip technique

primary_outcome.measure: Influence of the minimal invasive Clip technique on PISA in tranthoracic echocardiography
primary_outcome.description: Changes on the proximal isovelocity hemispheric surface area (PISA in square millimeter) in tranthoracic echocardiography due to the minimal invasiv Clip technique

primary_outcome.measure: Influence of the minimal invasive Clip technique on the effective regurgitant orifice (ERO) in tranthoracic echocardiography
primary_outcome.description: Changes on the effective regurgitant orifice (ERO in square millimeter) in tranthoracic echocardiography due to the minimal invasiv Clip technique

primary_outcome.measure: Influence of the minimal invasive Clip technique on the peak velocity of the mitral regurgitant jet (mR-Vmax) in tranthoracic echocardiography
primary_outcome.description: Changes on the peak velocity of the mitral regurgitant jet (mR-Vmax in meter per seconds) in tranthoracic echocardiography due to the minimal invasiv Clip technique

primary_outcome.measure: Influence of the minimal invasive Clip technique on the myocardial perfomance index (TEI-index) in tranthoracic echocardiography
primary_outcome.description: Changes on systolic and diastolic time intervals in expressing global systolic and diastolic ventricular function (without unity) in tranthoracic echocardiography due to the minimal invasiv Clip technique

secondary_outcome.measure: Post-interventional changes in daytime sleepiness with and without sleep disordered breathing
secondary_outcome.description: Post-interventional changes in daytime sleepiness with and without sleep disordered breathing measured by the Epworth Sleepinss Scale (ESS) (From 0 to 24 point-scale; A number in the 0-9 range is considered to be normal while a number in the 10-24 range indicates severe daytime sleepiness)

secondary_outcome.measure: Post-interventional survey of patient health with and without sleep disordered breathing
secondary_outcome.description: Post-interventional survey of patient health with and without sleep disordered breathing measured by the Short Form (36) Health Survey (SF-36). SF-36 consists of eight scaled score (Vitality, physical functioning, bodily pain, general health perceptions, physical role functioning, emotional role functioning, social role functioning and mental health). Total range from 0 to 100 points (from worst to best)

secondary_outcome.measure: Post-interventional assesment of Symptoms, function and quallity of life with and without sleep disordered breathing by patients with heart failure
secondary_outcome.description: Post-interventional assesment of Symptoms, function and quallity of life with and without sleep disordered breathing by patients with heart failure using the Kansas City Cardiomyopathy Questionnaire (KCCQ-12) that hat quantifies physical function, symptoms (frequency, severity and recent change), social function, self-efficacy and knowledge, and quality of life. Total range is from 0 to 100 points. 0 denotes the worst and 100 the best possible health status

secondary_outcome.measure: Post-interventional measurement of the adverse effects of heart failure on patient's life with and without sleep disordered breathing
secondary_outcome.description: Post-interventional measurement of the adverse effects of heart failure on patient's life with and without sleep disordered breathing using the Minnesota Living with Heart Failure Questionnaire. It provides a total score range 0-105, from best to worst

secondary_outcome.measure: Post-interventional assessment of the sleep quality with and without sleep disordered breathing
secondary_outcome.description: Post-interventional assessment of the sleep quality with and without sleep disordered breathing using the Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index (PSQI) (From 0 (worst) to 21 (best))

secondary_outcome.measure: Post-interventional changes in generic health status. with and without sleep disordered breathing
secondary_outcome.description: Post-interventional changes in generic health status. with and without sleep disordered breathing using the EQ-5D questionnaire (grade ranging from 0, the worst possible health status, to 100 ,the best possible health status

secondary_outcome.measure: Post-interventional changes aerobic capacity and endurance with and without sleep disordered breathing
secondary_outcome.description: Post-interventional changes on aerobic capacity and endurance with and without sleep disordered breathing using the cardiopulmonary exercise testing (vO2max in milliliter per minute per kilogram

secondary_outcome.measure: Post-interventional changes functional capacity of cardiopulmonary and musculoskeletal system with and without sleep disordered breathing
secondary_outcome.description: Post-interventional changes on aerobic capacity and endurance with and without sleep disordered breathing using the six minutes walk test (in meters)

secondary_outcome.measure: Post-interventional changes on cognitive functions with and without sleep disordered breathing
secondary_outcome.description: Post-interventional changes on cognitive functions with and without sleep disordered breathing using the Montreal Cognitive Assessment Test (MOCA) (From 0 (worst) to 30 (best) point-scale)

study_pop.textblock: Stationäre patients with severe valvular regurgitation and currently unknown sleep disorder breathing who will be treated with a minimal invasive Clip technique

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with severe valvular regurgitation and currently unknown sleep disorder breathing who will be treated with a minimal invasive Clip technique
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with more then one valvular disease which requires Treatment
- Patients with complex congenital heart disease
- Pregnant women
